metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9767 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
Directory traversal vulnerability in the ZipArchive::extractTo function inext/zip/php_zip.c in PHP before 5.4.45, 5.5.x before 5.5.29, and 5.6.xbefore 5.6.13 and ext/zip/ext_zip.cpp in HHVM before 3.12.1 allows remoteattackers to create arbitrary empty directories via a crafted ZIP archive.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9767` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.0 - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
libphp7.0-embed - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
php7.0 - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
php7.0-bcmath - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
php7.0-bz2 - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
php7.0-cgi - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
php7.0-cli - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
php7.0-common - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
php7.0-curl - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
php7.0-dba - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
php7.0-enchant - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
php7.0-fpm - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
php7.0-gd - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2

php7.0-mbstring - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
php7.0-mcrypt - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
php7.0-mysql - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
php7.0-odbc - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
php7.0-opcache - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
php7.0-pgsql - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
php7.0-phpdbg - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
php7.0-pspell - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2

php7.0-recode - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
php7.0-snmp - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
php7.0-soap - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
php7.0-sqlite3 - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
php7.0-sybase - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
php7.0-tidy - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2

php7.0-zip - 7.0.4-5ubuntu2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: php7.0 package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.0.4-5ubuntu2').
hhvm package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
